thread.title: The ‘official pumpkin’ of Boston is over 1,000 pounds - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: The ‘official pumpkin’ of Boston is over 1,000 pounds - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: The ‘official pumpkin’ of Boston is over 1,000 pounds - Massachusetts news
text:
The Boston Public Market is doing it up big this Halloween. And by big, we mean really big.
The “official pumpkin” of Boston (according to its very own Twitter handle: @BPMPumpking ), weighing in at a whopping 1,020-pounds, will arrive at the permanent year round indoor marketplace on Wednesday morning.
Related Link No shortage of Massachusetts pumpkins after ‘ideal growing year,’ crop experts say One of the market’s vendors, Red Apple Farm, partnered with farmer Tom Brouillet, both of Phillipston, Massachusetts, to grow the massive pumpkin. Together they have donated the colossal gourd to the market and city.
 Farmer Tom Brouillet with Boston’s pumpkin. Jane French The market will give consumers an opportunity to take photos with the pumpkin at the unveiling, as well as name it.
Every day is a big day when you're 1020 pounds! But thanks for looking out, @BosPublicMarket . I'm excited for tomorrow! #BPMpumpking
— BPM Pumpking (@BPMpumpking) October 20, 2015 The Boston Public Market will also host 12 other Halloween and fall-themed events throughout the month, including a pajama and pancake movie showing of Hocus Pocus , and an urban pumpkin patch and carving event along the Rose Kennedy Greenway.
Pumpkin being loaded to be brought to the Boston Public Market. Al Rose / Red Apple Farm
